alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Franklin; Hart; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 4:13PM EDT until August 07 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Franklin County in northeastern Georgia... Southeastern Stephens County in northeastern Georgia... Northwestern Elbert County in northeastern Georgia... Hart County in northeastern Georgia... Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina... Southwestern Pickens County in Upstate South Carolina... Southeastern Oconee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 413 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Seneca to 8 miles northwest of Hartwell to 7 miles east of Carnesville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Anderson, Clemson, Hartwell, Carnesville, Homeland Park, Northlake, Pendleton, Royston, Reed Creek and Lavonia. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
